docs.lead_paragraph: Just under 50 percent said they supported it, according to an opinion poll published in January.

headline.main: New King or, Spaniards Ask, Is It Time for No King?
headline.print_headline: New King or, Spaniards Ask, Is It Time for No King?

docs.abstract: King Juan Carlos's announcement that he is abdicating after nearly 40 years on the throne in favor of his son Felipe immediately raises question of whether Spain needs a monarchy at all; opinion polls published in January 2014 by conservative newspaper El Mundo show that just under 50 percent of Spaniards support the monarchy; thousands are demanding a referendum on whether to maintain the institution.
docs.snippet: Just under 50 percent said they supported it, according to an opinion poll published in January.

keywords.value: Juan Carlos I, King of Spain
keywords.name: persons

byline.contributor: Alan Cowell contributed reporting from London.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Seattle City Council has approved an ordinance that would raise the city's minimum wage to $15 an hour, making it the highest in the nation. Here are some questions and answers about the new hourly wage.

headline.print_headline: Seattle's $15 Minimum Wage: Questions and Answers

docs.lead_paragraph: Seattle activists celebrated a successful campaign to gradually increase the city's minimum wage to $15 by calling for a national movement to close the income and opportunity gaps between rich and poor.

headline.main: Seattle Raises Minimum Wage; Will Others Follow?
headline.print_headline: Seattle Raises Minimum Wage; Will Others Follow?

docs.snippet: Seattle activists celebrated a successful campaign to gradually increase the city's minimum wage to $15 by calling for a national movement to close the income and opportunity gaps between rich and poor.

docs.lead_paragraph: The City Council’s unanimous vote guarantees workers the highest big-city minimum wage in the nation, and more than double the federal level.

headline.main: Seattle Approves $15 Minimum Wage, Setting a New Standard for Big Cities
headline.print_headline: Seattle Approves $15 Minimum Wage, Setting a New Standard for Big Cities

docs.abstract: Seattle City Council unanimously approves minimum wage increase to $15 an hour, more than double the federal minimum; vote guarantees workers there the highest big-city minimum in the nation.
docs.snippet: The City Council’s unanimous vote guarantees workers the highest big-city minimum wage in the nation, and more than double the federal level.
